summary: This is a letter from attorney Peter M. Skinner of Boies Schiller Flexner LLP to an Assistant United States Attorney regarding compliance with a grand jury subpoena. The letter transmits supplemental materials from the Giuffre v. Maxwell civil case and requests confidential treatment under various legal provisions.

persons.name: Peter M. Skinner
persons.role: Attorney at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Author of the letter representing Boies Schiller Flexner LLP in responding to a grand jury subpoena and requesting confidential treatment for the produced materials.

persons.name: Judge McMahon
persons.context: Signed the Sealed Order (19 Misc. 149) dated April 9, 2019, which appears to govern the production of materials in response to the grand jury subpoena.

connections.description: Skinner references and complies with a sealed order signed by Judge McMahon regarding the production of materials under a grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was directed to Boies Schiller Flexner LLP by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Sealed Order Signed by Judge McMahon
events.description: Judge McMahon signed Sealed Order 19 Misc. 149, which governed the production of materials in response to the grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Protective Order Entered in Giuffre v. Maxwell
events.description: A protective order was entered in the civil case Giuffre v. Maxwell (15 Civ. 7433 (RWS)), which covers some of the materials being produced.

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, 55 Hudson Yards, New York, NY 10001
keyFacts: Boies Schiller Flexner LLP received a grand jury subpoena dated February 5, 2019, from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The firm is producing supplemental materials from the Giuffre v. Maxwell civil case (15 Civ. 7433) that are covered by a March 18, 2016 protective order.
The production includes hearing transcripts, expert reports, subpoenas, deposition notices, trial designations, and inadvertently omitted pleadings.
The letter strongly requests confidential treatment under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e), FOIA exemptions, the Privacy Act, and 18 U.S.C. ยง 1905.
The production is being made pursuant to a sealed order (19 Misc. 149) signed by Judge McMahon on April 9, 2019.
